page.title: 10HORTICULTURAL SHOW
page.content: The Horticultural Society was started in 1897. Holding an annual Summer Show, except during the 1939 - 45 War when it became a Produce Association, growing vegetables in a field by the Bell Pub. Additionally, there is an Autumn Show for chrysanthemums, dahlias and vegetables. The Summer Show has always been an important family social event in the village. The format has changed little over the years, there being classes for fruit, vegetables and flowers. There are childrens' sections for handicraft and art. The trophy for 'The Best Kept Garden' is highly prized. There have alwaus been side- shows, fancy dress and childrens' sports events.
